message.content:
We have to “net‐out” (or “accumulate”) the movements on the interest receivable account recorded in the transactions. In our data the “Interest Receivables” appear as separate lines. (Remember: an increase in receivable is a cash “use” so its impact on cash is reported with a negative sign.) For example, using the sample data the working steps are as follows:

1. Identify all rows whose type is “Interest Receivables” (their id begins with “Interest…”). For each one, note the “amount” value.
2. In our problem the following amounts were recorded:
  • Interest20240101001:   373.80  
  • Interest20240102002:   106.80  
  • Interest20240103003:   106.80  
  • Interest20240104004:   95.23  
  • Interest20240105005:   95.23  
  • Interest20240106006:   95.23  
  • Interest20240107007:   95.23  
  • Interest20240108008:   61.41  
  • Interest20240109009:   61.41  
  • Interest20240110010:   –18.69  
  • Interest20240111011:   –54.29  
  • Interest20240112012:   –27.59  
  • Interest20240113013:   16.91  
  • Interest20240114014:   16.91  
  • Interest20240115015:   16.91  
  • Interest20240116016:   16.91  
  • Interest20240117017:   16.91  
  • Interest20240118018:   16.91  
  • Interest20240119019:   16.91  
  • Interest20240120020:   16.91  
  • Interest20240121021:   16.91  
  • Interest20240122022:   16.91  
  • Interest20240123023:   16.91  
  • Interest20240124024:   16.91  
  • Interest20240125025:   16.91  
  • Interest20240126026:   0.88    (≈0.87964)  
  • Interest20240127027:   2.66    (≈2.65964)  
  • Interest20240128028:   11.56    (≈11.55964)  
  • Interest20240129029:   0.21    (≈0.21422)  
3. Adding these up step‐by‐step we get:  
  373.80 + 106.80 = 480.60  
  480.60 + 106.80 = 587.40  
  587.40 + 95.23 = 682.63  
  682.63 + 95.23 = 777.86  
  777.86 + 95.23 = 873.09  
  873.09 + 95.23 = 968.32  
  968.32 + 61.41 = 1029.73  
  1029.73 + 61.41 = 1091.14  
  1091.14 + (–18.69) = 1072.45  
  1072.45 + (–54.29) = 1018.16  
  1018.16 + (–27.59) = 990.57  
  990.57 + 16.91 = 1007.48  
  1007.48 + 16.91 = 1024.39  
  1024.39 + 16.91 = 1041.30  
  1041.30 + 16.91 = 1058.21  
  1058.21 + 16.91 = 1075.12  
  1075.12 + 16.91 = 1092.03  
  1092.03 + 16.91 = 1108.94  
  1108.94 + 16.91 = 1125.85  
  1125.85 + 16.91 = 1142.76  
  1142.76 + 16.91 = 1159.67  
  1159.67 + 16.91 = 1176.58  
  1176.58 + 16.91 = 1193.49  
  1193.49 + 16.91 = 1210.40  
  1210.40 + 0.88 = 1211.28  
  1211.28 + 2.66 = 1213.94  
  1213.94 + 11.56 = 1225.50  
  1225.50 + 0.21 = 1225.71  
4. Thus the ending balance (or net increase) in interest receivables is approximately 1225.71.
5. In the cash flow statement an increase in an asset like interest receivable is a use of cash and is therefore reported as a negative adjustment. (Because as receivables rise, cash available decreases.)
6. Therefore the final interest receivable adjustment is –1225.71.

Thus the answer is:

{
  "(Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable": "-1225.71"
}
